name: Kombu (Dried Sea Vegetable)
properties: Used in Japanese cuisine for broth
Optional ingredient for depth of flavor
benefits: Kombu is a type of dried edible kelp used in Japanese cooking to add deep umami flavor to broths and stocks. It contains natural glutamates which enhance savory taste without added salt or MSG. Rich in minerals including iodine, kombu provides nutritional benefits while acting as a flavor enhancer. A single strip infuses large batches of vegetable broth with complex, satisfying taste.
amount: 1 strip (2-inch/5cm piece) per large pot of broth or soup

quotes: Add the parsley, bay leaf, peppercorns, kombu (if using) and 2.85 litres of water
Stir in the tomatoes, mushrooms, kombu (if using), parsley, bay leaves and black pepper
